title: Why did Viktor name him blitzcrank?
body:
Viktor is a (sort of) Russian scientist. Blitzcrank is a parody of the German word blitzkrieg which means lightning war.

Lightning certainly fits into blitzcrank’s kit, but shouldn’t his name be more Russian instead of German?

I also think It would be fun if viktor was a German scientist instead of Russian, but that’s another conversation.

replies.body: Should have just called him Grab-Shock.
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

Like Rägnarok has already pointed out, Willump Bot has a pretty good answer for you. {{sticker:sg-ezreal}} But seriously, [Blitzcrank's bio](https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/champion/blitzcrank/) does confirm that Viktor personally named him. 

It kinda stands to reason. Since Blitzcrank was built to be an improvement over normal steam golems, his name most likely refers to one of the innovations Viktor made. Faster (blitz) internal mechanisms (crank). Blitzcrank later modified himself, maybe that's why he seems to be crankless today. But who knows what's really inside him? Maybe a plague rat he keeps in there as his best friend.

Anyway, I like [mrmeddyman](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/WhlGFQ9A-why-did-viktor-name-him-blitzcrank?comment=00010000)'s theory as well. Will check around to see if I can learn more about this rogue company, Riot Games. Are they Zaunite, or Piltovan?

But viktor has a Russian accent. So shouldn’t his creation be more Russian? That’s what’s up with the “sort of” part.

{{champion:266}} has a German accent, yet comes from a continent based on Ancient Egypt.

The fancy Piltovans are British {{champion:51}} {{champion:164}} but {{champion:81}}  isn't even though he was born and raised there.

Most Ionian should be speaking their own regional dialects but we only ever here {{champion:157}} speak bits and pieces (with an American accent no less) because his voice needs to make him sound like an samurai anime dubbed in English.

{{champion:11}}  speaks with an Asian accent when almost no other Ionian does because he needs to remind us of a Mister Miyagi archetype.

Accents in League are used to sell a character not a geographical origin. Viktor doesn't have a Russian accent because he's from a certain place. He speaks in a Russian accent because we as Americans can associate that with a mad scientist stereotype. That's the only reason.

And last but not least, if you call a 4-paragraph post an "essay", you should read a few other posts in this forum... Some of them are commonly 2-3 pages long.

Look, I had a really rough day, and I accidentally took it out on others.  I came to the boards with this question to have some fun and lighten my mood and look for an excuse as to why I think victor would be fun if he had a German accent. But when people tried to explain to me why Germans and Russians don’t exist in league, I got salty again, for whatever reason. For that, I’m sorry.

You came and admitted you were wrong, and apologized. Props to you and keep up that good attitude ;)

Just to be constructive: people in this forum tend to take questions seriously ^^' If you're just joking, make it clear, don't phrase it as a question. Alternatively, if the point of your post is *just* to make a joke, post it directly in the Memes & Games sub-board :)

But you're still welcome in the Story&Art sub-board anytime you want to talk about lore and the world of LoL. No matter your accent ;p

To answer yours Blitzcrank is called Blitzcrank because when was developed Riot didn't care about characterization or lore and just tried to hit a theme. Also Blitzcrank originally had nothing to do with Viktor, I believe he was just a robot created by random students. It was later they tried to integrate the characters in the lore by making them related

{{champion:41}} - Pirate execution measure
{{champion:21}} - Simple pun
{{champion:80}} - 300 rip off so may as well call him something Greek sounding

A lot of uninspired names in the early champions , it was gameplay first back then with a simple thematic to justify their existence

So I'd guess Blitzcrank is called Blitzcrank because it sounds robotic
